sentences.english: Distractions and annoyances are plentiful but don’t let the minor things get under your skin.
sentences.chinese: 为琐事分心和恼怒很常见，但是不要放在心上。

sentences.english: However, the queen of the land, Jezebel, was greatly enraged.
sentences.chinese: 可是，该地的王后耶洗别非常恼怒。

sentences.english: The tennis player was so annoyed that he belted the ball right out of the court.
sentences.chinese: 那个网球手恼怒地用力一挥把球打到网球场外去。

sentences.english: But when the disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, Why this waster?
sentences.chinese: 门徒看见，就恼怒说，何必这样枉费。

sentences.english: Yet he became very annoyed and resolved to find a means of avenging himself.
sentences.chinese: 可他又非常非常的恼怒，决定找个法子报仇雪恨。

sentences.english: The noise that trunks and ambulances made in the street rankles me every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天大街上卡车和救护车的噪音令我恼怒不已。

sentences.english: He glared at John and was annoyed by his refusal to cooperate.
sentences.chinese: 他瞪眼看着约翰，对他拒绝合作感到恼怒。

sentences.english: It was their serenity which galled her most.
sentences.chinese: 最让她恼怒的是他们的平静。

sentences.english: She was really burnt about that.
But there were some who were indignantly commenting among themselves: Why has this waste of the ointment been made?
sentences.chinese: 但有几个人恼怒著彼此说，何必这样枉费香膏？

sentences.english: Are they right to be annoyed?
sentences.chinese: 她们的这种恼怒对不对？

sentences.english: Mice bullies more angry, and immediately jump also chasing little white cat.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠恶霸更加恼怒，立刻也跳下去追逐小白猫。

sentences.english: And Ted added fuel to the flame by laughing at him.
sentences.chinese: 特德的取笑如火上加油，使他愈加恼怒。

sentences.english: Furious, the husband phoned the supermarket in the expectation of refuting his wife.
sentences.chinese: 恼怒的丈夫立即给超级市场打电话，准备驳斥妻子。

sentences.english: The insolence in the fellow's eye was galling.
sentences.chinese: 这家伙的傲慢目光令人恼怒。

definition: to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
